articles.description: A look at what's next for Manchester United after their Europa League final defeat - with focus on transfer plans, finances and the future of their head coach Ruben Amorim.
articles.title: Man Utd's future: Club resolute despite Tottenham loss

articles.description: BBC Sport analyses Tottenham's to-do list, from their manager's future, to recruitment plans and the bonuses for European glory.
articles.title: Europa League: Tottenham Hotspur's to-do list including Ange Postecoglou future

articles.description: Oscar Piastri tells BBC Sport how his "calm personality" helps him be "aggressive" on track - and what he has done to become a "faster driver" this year.
articles.title: Oscar Piastri: Get to know maybe the coolest, calmest Formula 1 driver in history

articles.description: As Zimbabwe toil against England a bowler light because of injury, BBC Sport asks whether the rules around substitutes in cricket should be changed.
articles.title: Cricket substitutes: Does Test cricket need to look at Laws again?

articles.description: In a wide-ranging interview with the BBC, Liverpool boss Arne Slot says excuses are "for teams that don't win the league".
articles.title: Liverpool boss Arne Slot on titles, Trent and transfers

articles.description: Real Madrid captain Luka Modric reveals he will leave the Spanish giants after the end of their Club World Cup campaign this summer.
articles.title: Luka Modric to leave Real Madrid after Club World Cup

articles.description: Raphinha says his "dream is to be at Barcelona until the end of my career" after signing a new deal to stay at the La Liga club until 2028.
articles.title: Raphinha: Barcelona winger wants to retire at La Liga side after extending contract until 2028

articles.description: Novak Djokovic celebrates his 38th birthday with victory over Matteo Arnaldi to reach the Geneva Open semi-finals.
articles.title: Geneva Open: Novak Djokovic reaches semi-finals on 38th birthday

articles.description: Who will England head coach Thomas Tuchel call up for two games in June, amid a hectic end of season schedule and the Club World Cup?
articles.title: England squad: Thomas Tuchel unlikely to make deals with clubs over playing time

articles.description: Ross County say a confrontation at the end of their Scottish Premiership play-off at Livingston was sparked by a home fan spitting at one of their coaching staff.
articles.title: Ross County claim Livingston fan spat in coach's face in Premiership play-off
